intro: Hibiscus arvensis, commonly known as the field hibiscus, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring alternate, palmately lobed leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red, which bloom from summer to autumn. Hibiscus arvensis is characterized by its fibrous, woody stems and is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides or in fields. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cotton and okra.
